narrative.title: 4Th Ccnn Division 3 Gennaio - 1940Q4
narrative.situation: Italian Blackshirt Militia Division (Camicie Nere) deployed in North Africa during 1940Q4.
narrative.objectives: Division held in reserve at Sidi Barrani, 12 miles inland from coast. Intended as mobile reserve for Italian 10th Army's defensive positions but immobilized by fuel shortages. Static defense role due to lack of transport and mechanization. Positioned to support Libyan Corps (1st and 2nd Libyan Divisions) in fortified camps.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain and rocky desert. Division positioned 12 miles inland from Sidi Barrani at reserve position.
weather.seasonal_impacts: Moderate rainfall begins in November-December (20-30mm monthly). Improved operating conditions compared to summer heat, but cold nights challenged troops with inadequate winter clothing. Better tank and vehicle mobility in cooler temperatures.
weather.environmental_challenges: Water scarcity remained critical despite cooler temperatures. Extended supply lines from Tripoli (over 1200km) via inadequate coastal road. British naval supremacy prevented sea resupply. Dust and sand continued to damage weapons and vehicles. Poor drainage in fortified positions during rain.
